thread.title: CineBistro theater in Hampden set to open Feb. 24 - Baltimore Business Journal
thread.title_full: CineBistro theater in Hampden set to open Feb. 24 - Baltimore Business Journal

author: Joshua Gordon
title: CineBistro theater in Hampden set to open Feb. 24 - Baltimore Business Journal
text: CineBistro theater in Hampden set to open Feb. 24 Feb 15, 2017, 2:11pm EST Industries & Tags Joshua Gordon Reporter Baltimore Business Journal Share 5 photos CineBistro joins the Rotunda in Hampden, which already has a MOMs Organic Market and… more CineBistro, a dinner and movie theater, is set to open on Feb. 24 as part of Hampden's Rotunda shopping complex at 727 W. 40th St. The 33,000-square-foot cinema is open only to guests 21 and older and offers full food and drink service from your seat, which is leather-bound and reclines. The building has seven auditoriums with between 70 and 100 seats in each for a total of 557 seats. 5 photos CineBistro joins the Rotunda in Hampden, which already has a MOMs Organic Market and… more The cinema also has a concierge desk, a full-service bar and a 60-seat lounge, which is open to the public. The Hampden location is the first in Maryland and only the 11th location nationwide. Tickets are on sale for opening night with the movie rundown including "Collide," "The Great Wall," "Fist Fight," "John Wick: Chapter Two," "La La Land" and "Fifty Shades Darker." CineBistro offers free validated parking with same-day ticket purchase. General Manager Derik Farrar said in December that much of the seating is reserved ahead of time, either in person or online. Guests are suggested to arrive at least 30 minutes before hand or even earlier if they want to get a drink before being seated. Menu prices range between $15-$29 for entrees and less for the rest of the menu. The bar will have a stock of 50 wine selections as well as craft drinks and a dozen beers on draft. Showtimes will vary, but first shows typically begin at 2 p.m. and the last showing will be between 10-11 p.m. Tickets are $13.50 during the week and before 4 p.m. on weekends and $15.75 after 4 p.m. on Fridays through Sundays. Any 3D showing will have an additional cost. Joshua covers hospitality, tourism, casinos and sports business. Industries
